column4: paging a guru:  My junk don't boot, suddenly.  Gives me "Mounting /dev/hda2 failed: no such device", drops me into busybox.  I can then mount /dev/hda2 with no problems.
My grub looks fine, my fstab looks fine.
Also, I blame MTecknology, because this happened because I rebooted while trying to get dual monitors working.
:D
yeah yeah.  Find me someone that knows how to fix it.  :\
what's crazy is now it won't even boot windows, either.
how does that relate to dual monitors?
nothing, except I rebooted.  Now it doesn't boot.  If I hadn't rebooted I'd be happily doing my thing.
could it be a faulty hard drive? i suggest you do backups soon
probably not, I've seen no signs of it going bad before now, and I can mount linux partitions from busybox with no problems.
I'm not ruling it out, but this is kind of seriously out of the blue.
can you sum' up your current partitions? (and OSes)
hda1: windows, hda2: linux /, hda3 extended for hda5 swap, and hda4 is spare space where I keep my music
windows still works?
what was that issue you said earlier
no, oddly.  Starts to boot, then bluescreens so fast I can't read it and then reboots automatically.
which issue?
so both windows and linux have issues out of nowhere?
yeah.  I know you're going to say bad hard drive.
backup right now, better safe than sorry
your hard drive was nice enough to give you a warning
not always
it could be another hardware issue, but i'm doubting it. it could be faulty ram
